content.body:
About the `Referer` with `location.replace` or `location.assign`: As detailed in my comment at https://github.com/WebKit/WebKit/pull/19093#discussion_r1378090398, testing (from a new test I wrote) indicates that Gecko and Blink set the referrer from the _parent_ frame.

I still donâ€™t clearly know what the particular relevant spec requirement is, so update the commit message to remove any claim that the change makes the implementation spec-conformant â€” and instead just kept the part of the commit message which states itâ€™s for interop/compat with Gecko and Blink.

I need to ping Alex to re-review it again, but I otherwise have no remaining changes of my own to make. If the goal is to have interop on this behavior across all engines, then I think the state of the implementation in the PR branch is whatâ€™s necessary for doing that.

content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> krosylight: in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1864395 is `type=number` a typo?

No, but I guess I shouldn't do that
content.formatted_body:
In reply to@annevk:matrix.org
krosylight: in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1864395 is type=number a typo?
No, but I guess I shouldn't do that

content.body: `type=number` is so attractive for identifiers, I also saw that mistake with `device-eid`
content.formatted_body: type=number is so attractive for identifiers, I also saw that mistake with device-eid

content.body: Perhaps `inputmode=numeric` needs a more attractive shorthand, but pretty hard to beat `type`
content.formatted_body: Perhaps inputmode=numeric needs a more attractive shorthand, but pretty hard to beat type

content.body: inputmode=numeric also doesn't do anything on desktop, hmm
